Posted By: MrBarrelRoll (4/29/2011 10:33:38 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Let's compare this to the other instants and sorceries that proliferate.  
  
[Fuel for the Cause](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fuel for the Cause): It's a [Counterspell](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Counterspell) that costs 2 more for proliferation.  
  
[Grim Affliction](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Grim Affliction): Similar to [Virulent Wound](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Virulent Wound) and [Instill Infection](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Instill Infection). Picking this over Virulent Wound means you pay 2 more for proliferation but your opponent doesn't get an extra poison counter when the creature dies. Picking this over Instill Infection means you get proliferation, lose the cantrip, and pay one mana less.  
  
[Spread the Sickness](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Spread the Sickness): Creature kill without restriction or an additional cost is pretty rare for black. I can't find many other precedents for it. Sorcery speed is a point against it, too. I don't think it's a bad card, but it's a little expensive for what it does, even if it is relatively unique.  
  
[Steady Progress](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Steady Progress): There are tons of cantrips for U. [Fleeting Distracti](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fleeting Distracti)... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Grim Affliction: Similar to Virulent Wound and Instill Infection. Picking this over Virulent Wound means you pay 2 more for proliferation but your opponent doesn't get an extra poison counter when the creature dies. Picking this over Instill Infection means you get proliferation, lose the cantrip, and pay one mana less.

Spread the Sickness: Creature kill without restriction or an additional cost is pretty rare for black. I can't find many other precedents for it. Sorcery speed is a point against it, too. I don't think it's a bad card, but it's a little expensive for what it does, even if it is relatively unique.

Turn 1: [Swamp](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Swamp); [Bloodchief Ascension](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bloodchief Ascension).  
Turn 2: [Mountain](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mountain); [Lightning bolt](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lightning bolt)/[Arc Trail](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Arc Trail)/any [Shock](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Shock)-related damage.  
Turn 3: [Swamp](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Swamp)/[Mountain](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mountain); [Volt Charge](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Volt Charge); let it resolve; Proliferate.  
Turn 4: [Doom Blade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Doom Blade)/[Go for the Throat](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Go for the Throat) the living crap out of their creatures.  
  
Hmmm...  
  
Still too slow, though...  
  
I'd go with the [Pyromancer Ascension](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pyromancer Ascension) combo.
